channel.title: Paypal question
channel.description: So I have a singapore unverified paypal account used for runescape buisness. After I made a sale fucking paypal limited my account saying it was accessed by a third party when it wasn't. It says to follow their steps and they want me to add a credit card. I don't have a credit card and my address is some made up one with singapore as the country. What should I do to get it unlocked?

item.title: Paypal question
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:18, topic:254418”]oh fuck now they want proof of address and a photo id…[/quote]If you really need to do something, you can always tell them you lied. They won’t care. I talked to customer support when I transferred my $260 out of my Make-Money-Off-RS/MSCP account into a legit account; I told them I was underage. They were like “alright, it’s cool.”

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“the bank, post:14, topic:254418”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=336196.msg2614382#msg2614382 date=1230942074]
Prepaid visa giftcards will unlock it.
[/quote]Yea, for like a week before they lock the account.[/quote]

If its unlocked for a week you can easily create a new account with real details as TeleNubby said and just transfer the money so you don’t lose it then forget about the old account.

item.title: Paypal question
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I had the same problem but here in the U.S.

Unfortunately, you can’t change your name. The only thing that can change is your last name (marriages, etc.) but you have to call PayPal and request it.

You can still change your address and phone number without a problem in your profile page. Do that. After, you’ll have to verify it with a bank account or PayPal Plus Credit Card. Adding a credit card simply allows you to send money, but it doesnt verify your account. Not to mention, most underground RuneScape players will refuse making transactions with a credit card funded account, as all you would have to do is contact the company for a refund/recharge.

Adding a credit card is simply and easy. I suggest doing that and transfering your money (send money) to a new account that you’ll make with real contact information. Doing this, you’ll end up fine. Then close your old account for good. You could also add multiple addresses/emails to your profile to hide your real identity when making transactions, although not reccommended.

Read full topic
